statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 5 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -7 \\ 0 \\ -11 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 5 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -7 \\ 0 \\ -11 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
